```{r message=FALSE, warning=TRUE, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = FALSE,
                      warning = FALSE)

```


```{r load corpus, message=FALSE, warning=TRUE, include=FALSE}
# Load Corpus
m_corpus <- get_m_corpus("../data/m_corpus.csv")  %>%
  select(speaker,
         gender,
         mode,
         prompt,
         phr_phon,
         utt_mean_f0) %>%
  mutate(starts_with_H =
           if_else(
             !is.na((str_extract(phr_phon, "%H|\\^\\[%H|% H\\*"))),
             TRUE,
             FALSE),
         starts_with_H = factor(starts_with_H, levels = unique(starts_with_H))
  )

```


### LME model analysis using initial model
```{r}
# set current equation
cur_equation  <-
  "utt_mean_f0 ~ mode + gender + starts_with_H + (1 + mode | speaker) + (1 | prompt)"

```

#### ``r cur_equation``

```{r fig.height=3, fig.width=9, message = FALSE, tidy = TRUE}
utt_mean_f0 = lmer(
  formula(cur_equation),
  data = m_corpus,
  control = lmerControl(
    optimizer = "optimx",
    calc.derivs = FALSE,
    optCtrl = list(
      method = "nlminb",
      starttests = FALSE,
      kkt = FALSE
    )
  )
)

summariseLME(utt_mean_f0 , run_step = TRUE,
              write="anova/utt_f0.csv")
```

```{r fig.height=3, fig.width=9, warning = FALSE, message = FALSE, tidy = TRUE}
utt_mean_f0.tidy <- printTidyModel(
  utt_mean_f0,
  write_r2="utt_f0"
)
utt_mean_f0.tidy$r2
```


```{r fig.height=3, fig.width=9, warning = FALSE, message = FALSE, tidy = TRUE}
# Get number of levels in target treatment variable.

charts <- getModelFixedFX(
  my_equation = utt_mean_f0 ~ mode + gender + starts_with_H +
    (1 + mode | speaker) + (1 | prompt),
  my_data = m_corpus,
  write="utt_f0"
)
charts$intercepts
charts$pairwise

```
